name: VegaLite

unions.name: AxisProperty
unions.comment: Generated by functions prefixed with `ax`, for example [axBandPosition](#axBandPosition).

unions.name: Cursor
unions.comment: Generated by functions that start with `cu`.

unions.name: ImMethod
unions.comment: The imputation method to use when replacing values.

unions.name: LegendProperty
unions.comment: Generated by functions prefied with `le`. For example [leCornerRadius](#leCornerRadius).

unions.name: LineMarker
unions.comment:
Appearance of a line marker that is overlaid on an area mark.
generated by [lmMarker](#lmMarker) and [lmNone](#lmNone).

unions.name: Measurement
unions.comment: Type of measurement to be associated with some channel.

unions.name: MonthName
unions.comment: Idntifies a month of the year.

unions.name: VLProperty
unions.comment:
Top-level Vega-Lite properties. These are the ones that define the core of the
visualization grammar. All `VLProperties` are created by functions in seven broad groups.

**Data properties** relate to the input data to be visualized. Generated by
[`dataFromColumns`](#dataFromColumns), [`dataFromRows`](#dataFromRows),
[`dataFromUrl`](#dataFromUrl), [`dataFromSource`](#dataFromSource) and
[`dataFromJson`](#dataFromJson).

**Transform properties** indicate that some transformation of input data should
be applied before encoding them visually. Generated by [`transform`](#transform)
and [`projection`](#projection) they can include data transformations such as
[`filter`](#filter), [`binAs`](#binAs) and [`calculateAs`](#calculateAs) and geo
transformations of longitude, latitude coordinates used by marks such as those
generated by [`geoshape`](#geoshape), [`point`](#point) and [`line`](#line).

**Mark functions** specify the symbols used to visualize data items. Generated
by functions such as [`circle`](#circle), [`bar`](#bar) and [`line`](#line).

**Encoding properties** specify which data elements are mapped to which mark
characteristics (known as _channels_). Generated by [`encoding`](#encoding) they
include encodings such as [`position`](#position), [`color`](#color), [`size`](#size),
[`shape`](#shape), [`text`](#text) and [`hyperlink`](#hyperlink).

**Composition properties** allow visualization views to be combined to form more
complex visualizations. Generated by [`layer`](#layer), [`repeat`](#repeat),
[`facet`](#facet), [`hConcat`](#hConcat), [`vConcat`](#vConcat), [`spec`](#spec)
and [`resolve`](#resolve).

**Interaction properties** allow clicking, dragging and other interactions generated
via a GUI or data stream to influence the visualization. Generated by
[`selection`](#selection).

**Supplementary and configuration properties** provide a means to add metadata and
styling to one or more visualizations. Generated by [`name`](#name), [`title`](#title),
[`description`](#description), [`background`](#background), [`width`](#width),
[`height`](#height), [`padding`](#padding), [`autosize`](#autosize) and
[`configure`](#configure).

aliases.name: Data
aliases.comment:
Convenience type annotation label for use with data generation functions.

    myRegion : List DataColumn -> Data
    myRegion =
        dataFromColumns []
            << dataColumn "easting" (nums [ -3, 4, 4, -3, -3 ])
            << dataColumn "northing" (nums [ 52, 52, 45, 45, 52 ])

aliases.name: DataColumn
aliases.comment: A single column of data. Used when generating inline data with [dataColumn](#dataColumn).

aliases.name: DataRow
aliases.comment: A single row of data. Used when generating inline data with [dataRow](#dataRow).

aliases.name: LabelledSpec
aliases.comment:
A named Vega-Lite specification, usually generated by an elm-vega
function. You shouldn't need to create `LabelledSpec` tuples directly, but are
useful for type annotations.

aliases.name: Spec
aliases.comment:
Part or all of Vega-Lite specification. Specs are usually nested
and can range from a single Boolean value up to the entire Vega-Lite specification.

values.name: aggregate
values.comment:
Aggregation transformations to be used when encoding channels. Useful when for
applying the same transformation to a number of channels without defining it each
time. The first parameter is a list of the named aggregation operations to apply.
The second is a list of 'group by' fields.

    trans =
        transform
            << aggregate
                [ opAs opMin "people" "lowerBound", opAs opMax "people" "upperBound" ]
                [ "age" ]
values.type: List.List VegaLite.Spec -> List.List String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: albers
values.comment: An Albers map projection.

values.name: albersUsa
values.comment: An Albers USA map projection that combines continental USA with Alaska and Hawaii.

values.name: align
values.comment:
Alignment to apply to grid rows and columns generated by a composition
operator. This version sets the same alignment for rows and columns.

values.name: alignRC
values.comment:
Similar to [align](#align) but with independent alignments for rows (first
parameter) and columns (second parameter).

values.name: anEnd
values.comment: Anchor some text at its end.

values.name: anMiddle
values.comment: Anchor some text in its start.

values.name: anStart
values.comment: Anchor some text at its start.

values.name: and
values.comment:
Apply an 'and' Boolean operation as part of a logical composition.

    and (expr "datum.IMDB_Rating === null") (expr "datum.Rotten_Tomatoes_Rating === null")

values.name: arColumn
values.comment: Column arrangement in a repeated/faceted view.

values.name: arRow
values.comment: Row arrangement in a repeated/faceted view.

values.name: area
values.comment:
An [area mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/area.html) for representing
a series of data elements, such as in a stacked area chart or streamgraph.

values.name: asContent
values.comment:
Interpret visualization dimensions to be for the data rectangle (external
padding added to this size).

values.name: asFit
values.comment:
Interpret visualization dimensions to be for the entire visualization (data
rectangle is shrunk to accommodate external decorations padding).

values.name: asNone
values.comment: No autosizing to be applied.

values.name: asPad
values.comment:
Automatically expand size of visualization from the given dimensions in order
to fit in all supplemtary decorations (legends etc.).

values.name: asPadding
values.comment:
Interpret visualization width to be for the entire visualization (data
rectangle is shrunk to accommodate external padding).

values.name: asResize
values.comment: Recalculate autosizing on every view update.

values.name: asSpec
values.comment:
Create a specification sufficient to define an element in a composed visualization
such as a superposed layer or juxtaposed facet. Typically a layer will contain a
full set of specifications that define a visualization with the exception of the
data specification which is usually defined outside of any one
layer. For repeated and faceted specs, the entire specification is provided.

values.name: autosize
values.comment:
Declare the way the view is sized. See the
[Vega-Lite autosize documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/size.html#autosize).

    enc = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ width 250
        , height 300
        , autosize [ asFit, asPadding, asResize ]
        , dataFromUrl "data/population.json" []
        , bar []
        , enc []
        ]

values.name: axBandPosition
values.comment: Position of axis tick relative to a band (0 to 1).

values.name: axDates
values.comment: Dates/times to appear along an axis.

values.name: axDomain
values.comment: Whether or not an axis baseline (domain) should be included as part of an axis.

values.name: axDomainColor
values.comment: Color of axis domain line.

values.name: axDomainOpacity
values.comment: Opacity of axis domain line.

values.name: axDomainWidth
values.comment: Width of axis domain line.

values.name: axFormat
values.comment:
[Format](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/format.html) to apply to
labels on an axis.

values.name: axGrid
values.comment: Whether or not grid lines should be included as part of an axis.

values.name: axLabelAlign
values.comment: Horizontal alignment of axis tick labels.

values.name: axLabelAngle
values.comment: Rotation angle in degrees of axis labels.

values.name: axLabelBaseline
values.comment: Vertical alignment of axis tick labels.

values.name: axLabelBound
values.comment:
How or if labels should be hidden if they exceed the axis range. If
`Nothing`, no check for label size is made. A number specifies the permitted
overflow in pixels.

values.name: axLabelColor
values.comment: Color of axis tick label.

values.name: axLabelFlush
values.comment:
How or if labels at beginning or end of the axis should be aligned. Specifies
the distance threshold from an end-point within which labels are flush-adjusted
or if `Nothing`, no flush-adjustment made.

values.name: axLabelFlushOffset
values.comment: Number of pixels by which to offset flush-adjusted labels.

values.name: axLabelFont
values.comment: Font name of an axis label.

values.name: axLabelFontSize
values.comment: Font size of an axis label.

values.name: axLabelFontWeight
values.comment: Font weight of an axis label.

values.name: axLabelLimit
values.comment: Maximum length in pixels of axis tick labels.

values.name: axLabelOpacity
values.comment: Opacity of an axis label.

values.name: axLabelOverlap
values.comment:
Overlap strategy for labels when they are too large to fit within the space
devoted to an axis.

values.name: axLabelPadding
values.comment: Padding in pixels between an axis and its text labels.

values.name: axLabels
values.comment: Whether or not axis labels should be displayed.

values.name: axMaxExtent
values.comment: Maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use.

values.name: axMinExtent
values.comment: Minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use.

values.name: axOffset
values.comment: Offset to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

values.name: axOrient
values.comment: Orientation of an axis relative to the plot it is describing.

values.name: axPosition
values.comment:
Anchor position of the axis in pixels. For x-axis with top or
bottom orientation, this sets the axis group x coordinate. For y-axis with left
or right orientation, this sets the axis group y coordinate.

values.name: axTickColor
values.comment: Color of axis ticks.

values.name: axTickCount
values.comment:
Desired number of ticks for axes visualizing quantitative scales.
The resulting number may be different so that values are nice (multiples of 2, 5, 10).

values.name: axTickExtra
values.comment:
Whether or not an extra axis tick should be added for the initial position
of an axis.

values.name: axTickOffset
values.comment: Offset in pixels of an axis's ticks, labels and gridlines.

values.name: axTickOpacity
values.comment: Opacity of axis ticks.

values.name: axTickRound
values.comment: Whether or not axis tick positions should be rounded to nearest integer.

values.name: axTickSize
values.comment: Tick mark size in pixels.

values.name: axTickStep
values.comment: Desired step size for ticks. Will generate corresponding tick count and values.

values.name: axTickWidth
values.comment: Width of axis ticks.

values.name: axTicks
values.comment: Whether or not an axis should include tick marks.

values.name: axTitle
values.comment:
Title to display as part of an axis. An empty string can be used
to prevent a title being displayed.

values.name: axTitleAlign
values.comment: Horizontal alignment of an axis title.

values.name: axTitleAngle
values.comment: Angle in degrees of an axis title.

values.name: axTitleBaseline
values.comment: Vertical alignment of axis title.

values.name: axTitleColor
values.comment: Color of axis title.

values.name: axTitleFont
values.comment: Font name for an axis title.

values.name: axTitleFontSize
values.comment: Font size for an axis title.

values.name: axTitleFontWeight
values.comment: Font weight of an axis title.

values.name: axTitleLimit
values.comment: Maximum length in pixels of axis title.

values.name: axTitleOpacity
values.comment: Opacity of an axis title.

values.name: axTitlePadding
values.comment: Padding in pixels between a title and axis.

values.name: axTitleX
values.comment: X position of an axis title relative to the axis group.

values.name: axTitleY
values.comment: Y position of an axis title relative to the axis group.

values.name: axValues
values.comment: Numeric values to appear along an axis.

values.name: axZIndex
values.comment:
Drawing order of the axis relative to the other chart elements. 1 indicates
axis is drawn in front of chart marks, 0 indicates it is drawn behind them.

values.name: axcoBandPosition
values.comment: Default axis band position.

values.name: axcoDomain
values.comment: Whether or not an axis domain should be displayed by default.

values.name: axcoDomainColor
values.comment: Default axis domain color.

values.name: axcoDomainOpacity
values.comment: Default axis domain opacity.

values.name: axcoDomainWidth
values.comment: Default axis domain width style.

values.name: axcoGrid
values.comment: Whether or not an axis grid is displayed by default.

values.name: axcoGridColor
values.comment: Default axis grid color style.

values.name: axcoGridDash
values.comment: Default axis line dash style.

values.name: axcoGridOpacity
values.comment: Default axis grid line opacity.

values.name: axcoGridWidth
values.comment: Default axis grid line width.

values.name: axcoLabelAlign
values.comment: Default axis label horizontal alignment.

values.name: axcoLabelAngle
values.comment: Default axis label angle.

values.name: axcoLabelBaseline
values.comment: Default axis label vertical alignment.

values.name: axcoLabelBound
values.comment:
Default axis label bounding when label exceeds available space. If `Nothing`,
no check for label size is made. A number specifies the permitted overflow in pixels.

values.name: axcoLabelColor
values.comment: Default axis label color.

values.name: axcoLabelFlush
values.comment:
Default label alignment at beginning or end of the axis. Specifies the distance
threshold from an end-point within which labels are flush-adjusted or if `Nothing`,
no flush-adjustment made.

values.name: axcoLabelFlushOffset
values.comment: Defailt number of pixels by which to offset flush-adjusted labels.

values.name: axcoLabelFont
values.comment: Default axis label font.

values.name: axcoLabelFontSize
values.comment: Default axis label font size.

values.name: axcoLabelFontWeight
values.comment: Default axis label font weight.

values.name: axcoLabelLimit
values.comment:
Default axis label limit (how much a label can extend beyond the
left/bottom or right/top of the axis line).

values.name: axcoLabelOpacity
values.comment: Default axis label opacity.

values.name: axcoLabelOverlap
values.comment:
Default axis label overlap strategy for cases where labels cannot
fit within the allotted space.

values.name: axcoLabelPadding
values.comment: Default axis label padding (space between labels in pixels).

values.name: axcoLabels
values.comment: Whether or not an axis has labels by default.

values.name: axcoMaxExtent
values.comment: Default maximum extent style.

values.name: axcoMinExtent
values.comment: Default minimum extent style.

values.name: axcoShortTimeLabels
values.comment: Whether or not an axis should use short time labels by default.

values.name: axcoTickColor
values.comment: Default axis tick mark color.

values.name: axcoTickExtra
values.comment:
Whether or not by default an extra axis tick should be added for the initial
position of axes.

values.name: axcoTickOffset
values.comment: Default offset in pixels of axis ticks, labels and gridlines.

values.name: axcoTickOpacity
values.comment: Default opacity of axis ticks.

values.name: axcoTickRound
values.comment: Whether or not axis tick labels use rounded values by default.

values.name: axcoTickSize
values.comment: Default axis tick mark size.

values.name: axcoTickStep
values.comment: Default step size for axis ticks.

values.name: axcoTickWidth
values.comment: Default axis tick mark width.

values.name: axcoTicks
values.comment: Whether or not an axis should show ticks by default.

values.name: axcoTitleAlign
values.comment: Default axis tick label horizontal alignment.

values.name: axcoTitleAngle
values.comment: Default axis title angle.

values.name: axcoTitleBaseline
values.comment: Default axis title vertical alignment.

values.name: axcoTitleColor
values.comment: Default axis title color.

values.name: axcoTitleFont
values.comment: Default axis title font.

values.name: axcoTitleFontSize
values.comment: Default axis title font size.

values.name: axcoTitleFontWeight
values.comment: Default axis title font weight.

values.name: axcoTitleLimit
values.comment: Default axis title maximum size.

values.name: axcoTitleOpacity
values.comment: Default opacity of axis titles.

values.name: axcoTitlePadding
values.comment: Default axis title padding between axis line and text.

values.name: axcoTitleX
values.comment: Default axis x-position relative to the axis group.

values.name: axcoTitleY
values.comment: Default axis y-position relative to the axis group.

values.name: azimuthalEqualArea
values.comment: An azimuthal equal area map projection.

values.name: azimuthalEquidistant
values.comment: An azimuthal equidistant map projection.

values.name: background
values.comment:
Background color of the visualization. Should be specified with a CSS
string such as `#ffe` or `rgb(200,20,150)`. If not specified the background will
be transparent.

values.name: bar
values.comment:
[Bar mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/bar.html) for histograms,
bar charts etc.

values.name: biBase
values.comment: Number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

values.name: biDivide
values.comment:
Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions for binning. The default value
is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), binning
will consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2.

values.name: biExtent
values.comment:
Desired range of bin values when binning a collection of values.
The first and second parameters indicate the minimum and maximum range values.

values.name: biMaxBins
values.comment: Maximum number of bins when binning a collection of values.

values.name: biMinStep
values.comment: Step size between bins when binning a collection of values.

values.name: biNice
values.comment:
Whether or not binning boundaries use human-friendly values such as multiples
of ten.

values.name: biStep
values.comment: Step size between bins when binning a collection of values.

values.name: biSteps
values.comment: Allowable step sizes between bins when binning a collection of values.

values.name: binAs
values.comment:
Binning transformation that may be referenced in other transformations or
encodings. The type of binning can be customised with a list of `BinProperty`
generating functions ([biBase](#biBase), [biDivide](#biDivide) etc.) or an empty
list to use the default binning.

    trans =
        transform
            << binAs [ biMaxBins 3 ] "IMDB_Rating" "ratingGroup"

Note that usually, direct binning within an encoding is preferred over this form
of bin transformation.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.BinProperty -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: boFlush
values.comment:
Bounds calculation should take only the specified width and height values for
a sub-view. Useful when attempting to place sub-plots without axes or legends into
a uniform grid structure.

values.name: boFull
values.comment:
Bounds calculation should use the entire plot area (including axes, title,
and legend).

values.name: boo
values.comment: A Boolean data value.

values.name: boos
values.comment: A list of Boolean data values.

values.name: bounds
values.comment:
Bounds calculation method to use for determining the extent of a sub-plot in
a composed view. If set to `Full` the entire calculated bounds including axes,
title and legend are used; if `Flush` only the width and height values for the
sub-view will be used.

values.name: boxplot
values.comment:
[Boxplot composite mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/boxplot.html)
for showing summaries of statistical distributions.

values.name: caAll
values.comment:
Subviews in a composed view to be aligned into a clean grid structure where
all rows and columns are of the same size (based on maximum subview size).

values.name: caButt
values.comment: Butt stroke cap.

values.name: caEach
values.comment:
Subviews in a composed view to be aligned into a clean grid structure where
each row or column may be of variable size.

values.name: caNone
values.comment:
Flow layout is to be applied to composed views, in which adjacent subviews
are placed one after the other.

values.name: caRound
values.comment: Rounded stroke cap.

values.name: caSquare
values.comment: Square stroke cap.

values.name: calculateAs
values.comment:
Generate a new data field based on calculations from existing fields.
The first parameter is an expression representing the calculation and the second
is the name to give the newly calculated field.

    trans =
        transform << calculateAs "datum.sex == 2 ? 'F' : 'M'" "gender"
values.type: String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: categoricalDomainMap
values.comment:
Create a set of discrete domain to color mappings suitable for customising categorical
scales. The first item in each tuple should be a domain value and the second the
color value with which it should be associated. It is a convenience function equivalent
to specifying separate `scDomain` and `scRange` lists and is safer as it guarantees
a one-to-one correspondence between domain and range values.

    color
        [ mName "weather"
        , mMType Nominal
        , mScale <|
            categoricalDomainMap
                [ ( "sun", "yellow" )
                , ( "rain", "blue" )
                , ( "fog", "grey" )
                ]
        ]

values.name: center
values.comment:
Whether or not sub-views specified in a composition operator should be centred
relative to their respective rows and columns.

values.name: centerRC
values.comment: Similar to [center](#center) but with independent centring for rows and columns.

values.name: chColor
values.comment: Color channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chOpacity
values.comment: Opacity channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chShape
values.comment: Shape channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chSize
values.comment: Size channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chX
values.comment: X-channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chX2
values.comment: X2-channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chY
values.comment: Y-channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: chY2
values.comment: Y2-channel to be used in a resolution specification

values.name: circle
values.comment:
[Circle mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/circle.html) for
symbolising points.

values.name: clipRect
values.comment:
Clipping rectangle in pixel units. The four parameters are respectively
'left', 'top', 'right' and 'bottom' of the rectangular clipping bounds.

values.name: coArea
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of area marks.

values.name: coAutosize
values.comment: Configure the default sizing of visualizations.

values.name: coAxis
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of axes.

values.name: coAxisBand
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of axes with band scaling.

values.name: coAxisBottom
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of bottom-side axes.

values.name: coAxisLeft
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of left-side axes.

values.name: coAxisRight
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of right-side axes.

values.name: coAxisTop
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of top-side axes.

values.name: coAxisX
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of x-axes.

values.name: coAxisY
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of y-axes.

values.name: coBackground
values.comment: Configure the default background color of visualizations.

values.name: coBar
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of bar marks.

values.name: coCircle
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of circle marks.

values.name: coCountTitle
values.comment: Configure the default title style for count fields.

values.name: coFieldTitle
values.comment: Configure the default title generation style for fields.

values.name: coGeoshape
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of geoshape marks.

values.name: coHeader
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of facet headers.

values.name: coLegend
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of legends.

values.name: coLine
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of line marks.

values.name: coMark
values.comment: Configure the default mark appearance.

values.name: coNamedStyle
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of a named style.

values.name: coNumberFormat
values.comment: Configure the default number formatting for axis and text labels.

values.name: coPadding
values.comment:
Configure the default padding in pixels from the edge of the of visualization
to the data rectangle.

values.name: coPoint
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of point marks.

values.name: coProjection
values.comment: Configure the default style of map projections.

values.name: coRange
values.comment: Configure the default range properties used when scaling.

values.name: coRect
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of rectangle marks.

values.name: coRemoveInvalid
values.comment:
Configure the default handling of invalid (`null` and `NaN`) values. If `true`,
invalid values are skipped or filtered out when represented as marks.

values.name: coRule
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of rule marks.

values.name: coScale
values.comment: Configure the default scale properties used when scaling.

values.name: coSelection
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of selection marks.

values.name: coSquare
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of square marks.)

values.name: coStack
values.comment: Configure the default stack offset style for stackable marks.

values.name: coText
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of text marks.

values.name: coTick
values.comment: Configure the default appearance of tick marks.

values.name: coTimeFormat
values.comment: Configure the default time format for axis and legend labels.

values.name: coTitle
values.comment: Configure the default style of visualization titles.

values.name: coTrail
values.comment: Configure the default style of trail marks.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: coView
values.comment: Configure the default single view style.

values.name: color
values.comment:
Encode a color channel. The first parameter is a list of mark channel properties
that characterise the way a data field is encoded by color.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: column
values.comment:
Encodes a new facet to be arranged in columns. The first parameter is a list
of properties that define the faceting channel. This should include at least the
name of the data field and its measurement type. See the
[Vega-Lite column documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/facet.html#row--column-encoding-channels)
values.type: List.List VegaLite.FacetChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: columnBy
values.comment:
The mapping between a column and its field definitions in a set of
faceted small multiples.

values.name: columnFields
values.comment:
Create a list of fields to use in set of repeated small multiples arranged in
columns. The list of fields named here can be referenced in an encoding with
`pRepeat column`, `mRepeat column` etc.

values.name: combineSpecs
values.comment:
Combines a list of labelled specifications that may be passed to JavaScript
for rendering. Useful when you wish to create a single page with multiple
visualizations.

    combineSpecs
        [ ( "vis1", myFirstVis )
        , ( "vis2", mySecondVis )
        , ( "vis3", myOtherVis )
        ]

values.name: configuration
values.comment: A configuration option to be applied globally across the visualization.

values.name: configure
values.comment:
Create a single global configuration from a list of configuration specifications.
See the [Vega-Lite documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/config.html).

    config =
        configure
            << configuration (coAxis [ axcoDomainWidth 1 ])
            << configuration (coView [ vicoStroke Nothing ])
            << configuration (coSelection [ ( seSingle, [ seOn "dblclick" ] ) ])

values.name: cubeHelix
values.comment:
Cube helix color interpolation for continuous color scales using the given
gamma value (anchored at 1).

values.name: cubeHelixLong
values.comment:
Long-path cube helix color interpolation for continuous color scales using
the given gamma value (anchored at 1).

values.name: customProjection
values.comment:
Custom projection type. Additional custom projections from d3 can be defined
via the [Vega API](https://vega.github.io/vega/docs/projections/#register) and
called from with this function where the parameter is the name of the D3
projection to use (e.g. `customProjection "winkel3"`).

values.name: dAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
level of detail (grouping) channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the
given operation parameter.

values.name: dBin
values.comment:
Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a level of detail
(grouping) channel.

values.name: dImpute
values.comment:
Set the iputation rules for a detail channel. See the
[Vega-Lite impute documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/impute.html)

values.name: dMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a level of detail (grouping) channel.

values.name: dName
values.comment: Field used for encoding with a level of detail (grouping) channel.

values.name: dTimeUnit
values.comment:
Form of time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a level of
detail (grouping) channel.

values.name: dataColumn
values.comment: Create a column of data. A column has a name and a list of values.
values.type: String.String -> VegaLite.DataValues -> List.List VegaLite.DataColumn -> List.List VegaLite.DataColumn

values.name: dataFromColumns
values.comment:
Declare a data source from a list of column values. Each column should contain
values of the same type, but columns each with a different type are permitted.
If columns do not contain the same number of items the dataset will be truncated
to the length of the shortest. A list of field formatting instructions can be
provided as the first parameter or an empty list to use the default formatting.
The columns are most easily generated with [dataColumn](#dataColumn):

    data =
        dataFromColumns [ parse [ ( "Year", foDate "%Y" ) ] ]
            << dataColumn "Animal" (strs [ "Fish", "Dog", "Cat" ])
            << dataColumn "Age" (nums [ 28, 12, 6 ])
            << dataColumn "Year" (strs [ "2010", "2014", "2015" ])

For more complex inline data tables, such as mixtures of arrays and objects, consider
using [dataFromJson](#dataFromJson).

values.name: dataFromJson
values.comment:
Declare a data source from a json specification. The most likely use-case is
creating [geojson](http://geojson.org) objects with [`geometry`](#geometry),
[`geometryCollection`](#geometryCollection) and [`geoFeatureCollection`](#geoFeatureCollection).
For more general cases of json creation such as data tables that mix arrays and
objects, consider
[`Json.Encode`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm-lang/core/5.1.1/Json-Encode).

    let
        geojson =
            geometry (geoPolygon [ [ ( -3, 59 ), ( 4, 59 ), ( 4, 52 ), ( -3, 59 ) ] ]) []
    in
    toVegaLite
        [ width 200
        , height 200
        , dataFromJson geojson []
        , projection [ prType orthographic ]
        , geoshape []
        ]

values.name: dataFromRows
values.comment:
Declare a data source from a list of row values. Each row should contain a
list of tuples in the form (_column name_, _value_). Each column can have a value
of a different type but you must ensure that values are of the same type as others
in the same column. A list of field formatting instructions can be provided as
the first parameter or an empty list to use the default formatting. Rows are most
easily generated with [dataRow](#dataRow).

    data =
        dataFromRows [ parse [ ( "Year", foDate "%Y" ) ] ]
            << dataRow [ ( "Animal", str "Fish" ), ( "Age", num 28 ), ( "Year", str "2010" ) ]
            << dataRow [ ( "Animal", str "Dog" ), ( "Age", num 12 ), ( "Year", str "2014" ) ]
            << dataRow [ ( "Animal", str "Cat" ), ( "Age", num 6 ), ( "Year", str "2015" ) ]

Generally, adding data by column is more efficient and less error-prone. For more
complex inline data tables, such as mixtures of arrays and objects, consider using
[dataFromJson](#dataFromJson).

values.name: dataFromSource
values.comment:
Declare data from a named source. The source may be from named `datasets` within
a specification or one created via the [Vega View API](https://vega.github.io/vega/docs/api/view/#data).
A list of field formatting instructions can be provided as the second parameter
or an empty list to use the default formatting.

    data = ...
    json = ...
    enc = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ datasets [ ( "myData", data [] ),  ( "myJson", dataFromJson json [] ) ]
        , dataFromSource "myData" []
        , bar []
        , enc []
        ]

values.name: dataFromUrl
values.comment:
Declare a data source from a url. The URL can be a local path on a web server
or an external (CORS) URL. A list of field formatting instructions can be provided
as the second parameter or an empty list to use the default formatting.

values.name: dataName
values.comment:
Name to give a data source. Useful when a specification needs to reference a
data source, such as one generated via an API call.

    data =
        dataFromUrl "myData.json" [] |> dataName "myName"

values.name: dataRow
values.comment: Create a row of data. A row comprises a list of (_columnName_, _value_) pairs.
values.type: List.List ( String.String, VegaLite.DataValue ) -> List.List VegaLite.DataRow -> List.List VegaLite.DataRow

values.name: datasets
values.comment:
Create a dataset comprising a collection of named `Data` items. Each data item
can be created with normal data generating functions such as [dataFromRows](#dataFromRows)
or [dataFromJson](#dataFromJson). These can be later referred to using
[dataFromSource](#dataFromSource).

    import Json.Encode as JE

    let
        data =
            dataFromRows []
                << dataRow [ ( "cat", str "a" ), ( "val", num 10 ) ]
                << dataRow [ ( "cat", str "b" ), ( "val", num 18 ) ]
        json =
            JE.list JE.object
                [ [ ( "cat", JE.string "a" ), ( "val", JE.float 120 ) ]
                , [ ( "cat", JE.string "b" ), ( "val", JE.float 180 ) ]
                ]

        enc = ...

    in
    toVegaLite
        [ datasets [ ( "myData", data [] ),  ( "myJson", dataFromJson json [] ) ]
        , dataFromSource "myData" []
        , bar []
        , enc []
        ]

values.name: date
values.comment: Day of the month (1-31) time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: day
values.comment: Day of the week time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: description
values.comment: Description to be associated with a visualization.

values.name: detail
values.comment:
Encode a 'level of detail' channel. This provides a way of grouping by a field
but unlike, say `color`, all groups have the same visual properties. The first
parameter is a list of the field characteristics to be grouped.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.DetailChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: doDts
values.comment: Date-time values that define a scale domain.

values.name: doNums
values.comment: Numeric values that define a scale domain.

values.name: doSelection
values.comment: Scale domain based on a named interactive selection.

values.name: doStrs
values.comment: String values that define a scale domain.

values.name: doUnaggregated
values.comment: Specify an unaggregated scale domain (type of data in scale).

values.name: domainRangeMap
values.comment:
Create a pair of continuous domain to color mappings suitable for customising
ordered scales. The first parameter is a tuple representing the mapping of the lowest
numeric value in the domain to its equivalent color; the second tuple the mapping
of the highest numeric value to color. If the domain contains any values between
these lower and upper bounds they are interpolated according to the scale's interpolation
function. Convenience function equivalent to specifying separate `scDomain` and
`scRange` lists and is safer as it guarantees a one-to-one correspondence between
domain and range values.

    color
        [ mName "year"
        , mMType Ordinal
        , mScale (domainRangeMap ( 1955, "#e6959c" ) ( 2000, "#911a24" ))
        ]
values.type: ( Basics.Float, String.String ) -> ( Basics.Float, String.String ) -> List.List VegaLite.ScaleProperty

values.name: dsv
values.comment: Delimited file format (DSV) with a given separator.

values.name: dt
values.comment: Date-time data value.

values.name: dtDate
values.comment: Day of the month (1 to 31).

values.name: dtDay
values.comment: Day of the week.

values.name: dtHour
values.comment: Hour of the day (0=midnight, 1=1am, 23=11pm etc.).

values.name: dtMillisecond
values.comment: Millisecond of a second (0-999).

values.name: dtMinute
values.comment: Minute of an hour (0-59).

values.name: dtMonth
values.comment: Month of a year (1 to 12).

values.name: dtQuarter
values.comment: Year quarter (1 to 4).

values.name: dtRange
values.comment:
Min max date-time range to be used in data filtering. If either
parameter is an empty list, it is assumed to be unbounded.

values.name: dtSecond
values.comment: Second of a minute (0-59).

values.name: dtYear
values.comment: A year.

values.name: dts
values.comment: List of date-time data values.

values.name: encoding
values.comment:
Create an encoding specification from a list of channel encodings. These are
commonly built by chaining series of `LabelledSpec` generating functions together.
For example,

    enc =
        encoding
            << position X [ pName "month", pMType Temporal ]
            << position Y [ pName "score", pMType Quantitative ]
            << color [ mName "team", mMType Nominal ]

values.name: equirectangular
values.comment:
An equirectangular (default) map projection that maps longitude to x and
latitude to y.

values.name: errorband
values.comment:
[Errorband composite mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/errorband.html)
for showing summaries of variation along a signal. By default no border is drawn.
To add a border with default properties use [maBorders](#maBorders) with an empty list.

values.name: errorbar
values.comment:
[Errorbar composite mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/errorbar.html)
for showing summaries of variation along a signal. By default no ticks are drawn.
To add ticks with default properties use [maTicks](#maTicks) with an empty list.

values.name: exCi
values.comment: Band extent between the 95% confidence intervals of a distribution.

values.name: exIqr
values.comment: Band extent between the lower and upper quartiles of a distribution.

values.name: exIqrScale
values.comment:
A scaling of the interquartile range to be used as whiskers in a boxplot.
For example a value of 1.5 would extend whiskers to 1.5x the IQR from the mean.

values.name: exRange
values.comment: Band extent between the minumum and maximum values in a distribution.

values.name: exStderr
values.comment: Band extent as the standard error about the mean of a distribution.

values.name: exStdev
values.comment: Band extent as the standard deviation of a distribution.

values.name: expr
values.comment:
Expression that should evaluate to either true or false. Can use any valid
[Vega expression](https://vega.github.io/vega/docs/expressions/).

values.name: fAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
facet channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: fBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a facet channel.

values.name: fHeader
values.comment: Guide that spans a collection of faceted plots, each of which may have their own axes.

values.name: fMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a facet channel.

values.name: fName
values.comment: Field used for encoding with a facet channel.

values.name: fSort
values.comment:
Sort order for a field when encoding with a faceted channel. For example,

    row
        [ fName "site"
        , fMType Ordinal
        , fSort [ soByField "x" opMedian, soDescending ]
        ]

values.name: fTimeUnit
values.comment: Form of time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a facet channel.

values.name: facet
values.comment:
Fields to be used to facet a view in rows or columns creating a set of small
multiples. Used when the encoding of the visualization in small multiples is
identical, but data for each is grouped by the given fields. When
creating a faceted view in this way you also need to define a full specification
to apply to each of those facets using `asSpec`.

    spec = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ facet [ rowBy [ fName "Origin", fMType Nominal ] ]
        , specifcation spec
        ]

values.name: false
values.comment:
A false value used for functions that can accept a Boolean literal or a
reference to something that generates a Boolean value. Convenience function
equivalent to `boo False`

values.name: fiCompose
values.comment: Build up a filtering predicate through logical composition (`and`, `or` etc.).

values.name: fiEqual
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field equal to the given
value are used.

values.name: fiExpr
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data that satisfy the given predicate
expression are used.

values.name: fiGreaterThan
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field greater than the given
value are used.

values.name: fiGreaterThanEq
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field greater than or equal
to the given value are used.

values.name: fiLessThan
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field less than the given
value are used.

values.name: fiLessThanEq
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field less than or equal to
the given value are used.

values.name: fiOneOf
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field contained in the given
list of values are used.

values.name: fiRange
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field that are within the
given range are used.

values.name: fiSelection
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only data in a given field that are within the
given interactive selection are used.

values.name: fiValid
values.comment:
Filter a data stream so that only valid data (i.e. not null or NaN) in a given
field are used.

values.name: fill
values.comment:
Encode a fill channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by `color` but
only affects the interior of closed shapes. If both `fill` and `color` encodings
are specified, `fill` takes precedence.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: fillOpacity
values.comment:
Encode a fill opacity channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by `opacity`
but only affects the interior of closed shapes. If both `fillOpacity` and `opacity`
encodings are specified, `fillOpacity` takes precedence.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: filter
values.comment: Apply a filter to a channel or field.

values.name: flatten
values.comment: Map array-valued fields to a set of individual data objects, one per array entry.
values.type: List.List String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: flattenAs
values.comment:
Similar to [flatten](#flatten) but allows the new output fields to be named
(second parameter).
values.type: List.List String.String -> List.List String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: foBoo
values.comment: Indicate Boolean data type to be parsed when reading input data.

values.name: foDate
values.comment:
Date format for parsing input data using
[D3's formatting specifiers](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/data.html#format)
or left as an empty string for default formatting.

values.name: foNum
values.comment: Indicate numeric data type to be parsed when reading input data.

values.name: foUtc
values.comment: Similar to [foDate](#foDate) but for UTC format dates.

values.name: fold
values.comment:
Collapse one or more data fields into two properties: a _key_ (containing
the original data field name) and a _value_ (containing the data value). Useful
for mapping matrix or cross-tabulation data into a standardized format.
values.type: List.List String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: foldAs
values.comment:
Similar to [fold](#fold) but allows the new output `key` and `value` fields
to be given alternative names
values.type: List.List String.String -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: ftFunction
values.comment: Field titles to be displayed as 'SUM(field)', 'YEAR(date)' etc.

values.name: ftPlain
values.comment: Field titles to be displayed simply by their name without additional text.

values.name: ftVerbal
values.comment: Field titles to be displayed fully as 'Sum of field', 'Year of date' etc.

values.name: geoFeatureCollection
values.comment:
Geo features to be used in a `geoshape` specification. Each feature object in
this collection can be created with [geometry](#geometry).

    geojson =
        geoFeatureCollection
            [ geometry (geoPolygon [ [ ( -3, 59 ), ( -3, 52 ), ( 4, 52 ), ( -3, 59 ) ] ])
                [ ( "myRegionName", str "Northern region" ) ]
            , geometry (geoPolygon [ [ ( -3, 52 ), ( 4, 52 ), ( 4, 45 ), ( -3, 52 ) ] ])
                [ ( "myRegionName", str "Southern region" ) ]
            ]

values.name: geoLine
values.comment:
Line geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent to the
[GeoJson geometry `line` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geoLines
values.comment:
Multi-line geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent
to the [GeoJson geometry `multi-line` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geoPoint
values.comment:
Point geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent to
the [GeoJson geometry `point` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geoPoints
values.comment:
Multi-point geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent
to the [GeoJson geometry `multi-point` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geoPolygon
values.comment:
Polygon geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent
to the [GeoJson geometry `polygon` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geoPolygons
values.comment:
Multi-polygon geometry for programmatically creating GeoShapes. Equivalent
to the [GeoJson geometry `multi-polygon` type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1).

values.name: geometry
values.comment:
Geometric object to be used in a `geoshape`. The first parameter is
the geometric type, the second an optional list of properties to be associated
with the object.

      geojson =
          geometry (geoPolygon [ [ ( -3, 59 ), ( 4, 59 ), ( 4, 52 ), ( -3, 59 ) ] ]) []

values.name: geometryCollection
values.comment:
Geometry objects to be used in a `geoshape` specification. Each geometry
object can be created with [geometry](#geometry).

    geojson =
        geometryCollection
            [ geometry (geoPolygon [ [ ( -3, 59 ), ( 4, 59 ), ( 4, 52 ), ( -3, 59 ) ] ]) []
            , geometry (geoPoint -3.5 55.5) []
            ]

values.name: geoshape
values.comment:
[Geoshape](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/geoshape.html)
determined by geographically referenced coordinates.

values.name: gnomonic
values.comment: A gnomonic map projection.

values.name: hAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
hyperlink channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: hBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a hyperlink channel.

values.name: hBinned
values.comment: Indicate that data encoded with a hyperlink channel are already binned.

values.name: hConcat
values.comment: Specifications to be juxtaposed horizontally in a visualization.

values.name: hDataCondition
values.comment:
Make a hyperlink channel conditional on some predicate expression. The first
parameter provides the expression to evaluate, the second the encoding to apply
if the expression is true, the third the encoding if the expression is false.
values.type: VegaLite.BooleanOp -> List.List VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel -> VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel

values.name: hMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a hyperlink channel.

values.name: hName
values.comment: Field used for encoding with a hyperlink channel.

values.name: hRepeat
values.comment:
Reference in a hyperlink channel to a field name generated by `repeat`. The
parameter identifies whether reference is being made to fields being laid out
in columns or in rows.

values.name: hSelectionCondition
values.comment:
Make a hyperlink channel conditional on interactive selection. The first parameter
provides the selection to evaluate, the second the encoding to apply if the hyperlink
has been selected, the third the encoding if it is not selected.
values.type: VegaLite.BooleanOp -> List.List VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel -> VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel

values.name: hStr
values.comment: Literal string value when encoding with a hyperlink channel.

values.name: hTimeUnit
values.comment: Time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a hyperlink channel.

values.name: haCenter
values.comment: Center horizontal text alignment.

values.name: haLeft
values.comment: Left horizontal text alignment.

values.name: haRight
values.comment: Right horizontal text alignment.

values.name: hcl
values.comment: HCL color interpolation for continuous color scales.

values.name: hclLong
values.comment: HCL color interpolation in polar coordinate space for continuous color scales.

values.name: hdFormat
values.comment: Header format for a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelAngle
values.comment:
Header label rotation angle (in degrees) for a faceted view. A 'label' is the
title for each sub-plot in a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelColor
values.comment: Header label text color for a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelFont
values.comment: Header label font for a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelFontSize
values.comment: Header label font size for a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelLimit
values.comment: Maximum length of a header label in a faceted view.

values.name: hdLabelPadding
values.comment: Spacing in pixels between facet labels and the main plot area.

values.name: hdTitle
values.comment:
Header title in a faceted view. A 'title' is the overall title describing
the collection of faceted plots.

values.name: hdTitleAnchor
values.comment: Anchor position of a header title in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleAngle
values.comment: Text angle of a header title in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleBaseline
values.comment: Vertical alignment of a header title in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleColor
values.comment: Text color of a header title in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleFont
values.comment: Title font in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleFontSize
values.comment: Title font size in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleFontWeight
values.comment: Title font weight in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitleLimit
values.comment: Maximum length of a header title in a faceted view.

values.name: hdTitlePadding
values.comment: Spacing in pixels between the main facet title and labels.

values.name: height
values.comment:
Override the default height of the visualization. If not specified the height
will be calculated based on the content of the visualization.

values.name: hours
values.comment: Hour of the day time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: hoursMinutes
values.comment: Hours and minutes time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: hoursMinutesSeconds

values.name: lookup
values.comment:
Perform a lookup of named fields between two data sources. This allows you to
find values in one data source based on the values in another. The first parameter
is the field in the primary data source to act as key, the second is the secondary
data source which can be specified with a call to `dataFromUrl` or other data
generating function. The third is the name of the field in the secondary
data source to match values with the primary key. The fourth parameter is the list
of fields to be stored when the keys match.
values.type: String.String -> ( VegaLite.VLProperty, VegaLite.Spec ) -> String.String -> List.List String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: lookupAs
values.comment:
Similar to [lookup](#lookup) but returns the entire set of field values from
the secondary data source when keys match. Accessed with via name provided in the
fourth parameter.
values.type: String.String -> VegaLite.Data -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: mAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
mark property channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: mBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mBinned
values.comment: Indicate that data encoding with a mark are already binned.

values.name: mBoo
values.comment: Boolean value when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mDataCondition
values.comment:
Make a mark channel conditional on one or more predicate expressions. The first
parameter is a list of tuples each pairing a test condition with the encoding if
that condition evaluates to true. The second is the encoding if none of the tests
are true.

    color
        [ mDataCondition [ ( expr "datum.myField === null", [ mStr "grey" ] ) ]
            [ mStr "black" ]
        ]
values.type: List.List ( VegaLite.BooleanOp, List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel ) -> List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> VegaLite.MarkChannel

values.name: mImpute
values.comment:
Iputation rules for a mark channel. See the
[Vega-Lite impute documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/impute.html)

values.name: mLegend
values.comment:
Properties of a legend that describes a mark's encoding. For no legend, provide
an empty list as a parameter.

values.name: mMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mName
values.comment: Field used for encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mNum
values.comment: Literal numeric value when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mPath
values.comment:
SVG path string used when encoding with a mark property channel. Useful
for providing custom shapes.

values.name: mRepeat
values.comment:
Reference in a mark channel to a field name generated by `repeat`. The
parameter identifies whether fields are to be laid out in columns or rows.

values.name: mScale
values.comment:
Scaling applied to a field when encoding with a mark property channel.
The scale will transform a field's value into a color, shape, size etc.

values.name: mSelectionCondition
values.comment:
Make a mark channel conditional on interactive selection. The first parameter
is a selection condition to evaluate; the second the encoding to apply if that selection
is true; the third parameter is the encoding if the selection is false.

    color
        [ mSelectionCondition (selectionName "myBrush")
            [ mName "myField", mMType Ordinal ]
            [ mStr "grey" ]
        ]
values.type: VegaLite.BooleanOp -> List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> VegaLite.MarkChannel

values.name: mStr
values.comment: Literal string value when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mTimeUnit
values.comment: Time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a mark property channel.

values.name: mTitle
values.comment: Title of a field when encoding with a mark property channel.
