values.name: not
values.comment:
Apply a negation Boolean operation as part of a logical composition. Boolean
operations can be nested to any level.

    not (and (expr "datum.IMDB_Rating === null") (expr "datum.Rotten_Tomatoes_Rating === null"))

values.name: num
values.comment: A numeric data value.

values.name: numRange
values.comment: Minimum-maximum number range to be used in data filtering.

values.name: nums
values.comment: List of numeric data values.

values.name: oAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with an
order channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: oBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with an order channel.

values.name: oMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with an order channel.

values.name: oName
values.comment: Name of the field used for encoding with an order channel.

values.name: oRepeat
values.comment:
Reference in a order channel to a field name generated by `repeat`. The
parameter identifies whether reference is being made to fields that are to be
laid out in columns or in rows.

values.name: oSort
values.comment: Sort order to be used by an order channel.

values.name: oTimeUnit
values.comment: Time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with an order channel.

values.name: opArgMax
values.comment:
An input data object containing the maximum field value to be used in an
aggregation operation.

values.name: opArgMin
values.comment:
An input data object containing the minimum field value to be used in an
aggregation operation.

values.name: opAs
values.comment:
Aggregation operation. The first parameter is the operation to use; the second
the name of the field in which to apply it and the third the name to be given to
this transformation.

    trans =
        transform
            << aggregate
                [ opAs opMin "people" "lowerBound"
                , opAs opMax "people" "upperBound"
                ]
                [ "age" ]

If the operation is `Count`, it does not apply to any specific field, so the second
parameter can be an empty string.

values.name: opCI0
values.comment: Lower 95% confidence interval to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opCI1
values.comment: Upper 95% confidence interval to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opCount
values.comment: Total count of data objects to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opDistinct
values.comment: Count of distinct data objects to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opMax
values.comment: Maximum field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opMean
values.comment: Mean value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opMedian
values.comment: Median field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opMin
values.comment: Minimum field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opMissing
values.comment: Count of null or undefined field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opQ1
values.comment: Lower quartile boundary of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opQ3
values.comment: Upper quartile boundary of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opStderr
values.comment: Standard error of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opStdev
values.comment: Sample standard deviation of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opStdevP
values.comment: Population standard deviation of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opSum
values.comment: Sum of field values to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opValid
values.comment:
Count of values that are not `null`, `undefined` or `NaN` to be used in an
aggregation operation.

values.name: opVariance
values.comment: Sample variance of field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opVarianceP
values.comment: Population variance of field value to be used in an aggregation operation.

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Encode an opacity channel.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: or
values.comment: Apply an 'or' Boolean operation as part of a logical composition.

values.name: order
values.comment: Encode an order channel with a list of order field definitions.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.OrderChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: orthographic
values.comment: An orthographic map projection.

values.name: osGreedy
values.comment: Greedy overlap strategy to be applied when there is not space to show all items on an axis.

values.name: osNone
values.comment: No overlap strategy to be applied when there is not space to show all items on an axis.

values.name: osParity
values.comment:
Give all items equal weight in overlap strategy to be applied when there is
not space to show them all on an axis.

values.name: pAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
position channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: pAxis
values.comment:
Axis properties used when encoding with a position channel. For no axis,
provide an empty list.

values.name: pBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pBinned
values.comment: Indicate that data encoded with position are already binned.

values.name: pHeight
values.comment:
Set the position to the height of the enclosing data space. Useful for placing
a mark relative to the bottom edge of a view.

values.name: pImpute
values.comment:
Imputation rules for a position channel. See the
[Vega-Lite impute documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/impute.html)

values.name: pMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pName
values.comment: Name of the field used for encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pRepeat
values.comment: Arrangement of views in a repeated composite view.

values.name: pScale
values.comment:
Scaling applied to a field when encoding with a position channel.
The scale will transform a field's value into a position along one axis.

values.name: pSort
values.comment: Sort order for field when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pStack
values.comment: Type of stacking offset for field when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pTimeUnit
values.comment: Form of time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pTitle
values.comment: Title of a field when encoding with a position channel.

values.name: pWidth
values.comment:
Set the position to the width of the enclosing data space. Useful for justifying
a mark to the right hand edge of a view. e.g. to position a mark at the right of
the data rectangle:

    enc =
        encoding
            << position X [ pWidth ]

values.name: paEdges
values.comment:
Padding around a visualization in pixel units. The four parameters
refer to _left_, _top_, _right_, and _bottom_ edges respectively.

values.name: paSize
values.comment: Indicate uniform padding around a visualization in pixel units.

values.name: padding
values.comment:
Padding around the visualization in pixel units. The way padding is interpreted
will depend on the `autosize` properties.

values.name: parse
values.comment:
Parsing rules when processing some data text, specified as a list of tuples
in the form (_fieldname_, _datatype_). If an empty list is provided, type inference
is based on the data.

values.name: pmMarker
values.comment: Properties of a point marker that is overlaid on a line or area mark.

values.name: pmNone
values.comment: No point marker to be shown on a line or area mark.

values.name: pmTransparent
values.comment:
Transparent point marker to be placed on area or line mark. Useful for
interactive selections.

values.name: point
values.comment:
[Point mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/point.html) for
symbolising a data point with a symbol.

values.name: position
values.comment:
Encode a position channel. The first parameter identifies the channel,
the second a list of encoding options.
values.type: VegaLite.Position -> List.List VegaLite.PositionChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: prCenter
values.comment: Projections center as longitude and latitude in degrees.

values.name: prClipAngle
values.comment:
Projections clipping circle radius to the specified angle in degrees.
A value of `Nothing` will switch to antimeridian cutting rather than small-circle
clipping.

values.name: prClipExtent
values.comment: Projections viewport clip extent to the specified bounds in pixels.

values.name: prCoefficient
values.comment: 'Hammer' map projection coefficient.

values.name: prDistance
values.comment: 'Satellite' map projection distance.

values.name: prFraction
values.comment: `Bottomley` map projection fraction.

values.name: prLobes
values.comment: Number of lobes in lobed map projections such as the 'Berghaus star'.

values.name: prParallel
values.comment: Parallel for map projections such as the 'Armadillo'.

values.name: prPrecision
values.comment:
Threshold for the projections adaptive resampling in pixels.
Corresponds to the DouglasPeucker distance. If precision is not specified, the
projections current resampling precision of 0.707 is used.

values.name: prRadius
values.comment: Radius value for map projections such as the 'Gingery'.

values.name: prRatio
values.comment: Ratio value for map projections such as the 'Hill'.

values.name: prRotate
values.comment:
Projections three-axis rotation angle. This should be in order _lambda phi
gamma_ specifying the rotation angles in degrees about each spherical axis.

values.name: prSpacing
values.comment: Spacing value for map projections such as the 'Lagrange'.

values.name: prTilt
values.comment: 'Satellite' map projection tilt.

values.name: prType
values.comment: Type of global map projection.

values.name: projection
values.comment: Map projection used for geospatial coordinates.

values.name: quarter
values.comment: Year quarter time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: quarterMonth
values.comment: Year quarter and month time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: raName
values.comment: Name of a pre-defined scale range (e.g. `symbol` or `diverging`).

values.name: raNums
values.comment:
Numeric scale range. Depending on the scaling this may be a [min, max]
pair, or a list of explicit numerical values.

values.name: raStrs
values.comment: Text scale range for discrete scales.

values.name: racoCategory
values.comment: Default color scheme for categorical ranges.

values.name: racoDiverging
values.comment: Default diverging color scheme.

values.name: racoHeatmap
values.comment: Default 'heatmap' color scheme.

values.name: racoOrdinal
values.comment: Default ordinal color scheme.

values.name: racoRamp
values.comment: Default ramp (continuous) color scheme.

values.name: racoSymbol
values.comment: Default color scheme symbols.

values.name: reAxis
values.comment:
Indicate how a channel's axes should be resolved when defined in more than
one view in a composite visualization.

values.name: reIndependent
values.comment: Scale domain should be independent of others in a composite visualization.

values.name: reLegend
values.comment:
Indicate how a channel's legends should be resolved when defined in more
than one view in a composite visualization.

values.name: reScale
values.comment:
Indicate how a channel's scales should be resolved when defined in more
than one view in a composite visualization.

values.name: reShared
values.comment: Scale domain should be shared with others in a composite visualization.

values.name: rect
values.comment: [Rectangle mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/rect.html).

values.name: repeat
values.comment:
Define the fields that will be used to compose rows and columns of a set of
small multiples. Used when the encoding largely identical, but the data field used
in each might vary. When a list of fields is identified with `repeat` you also
need to define a full specification to apply to each of those fields using `asSpec`.

    spec = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ repeat [ columnFields [ "Cat", "Dog", "Fish" ] ]
        , specification (asSpec spec)
        ]

values.name: resolution
values.comment:
Define a resolution option to be applied when scales, axes or legends in composite
views share channel encodings. This allows different color encodings to be created
in a layered view, which would otherwise share color channels between layers. Each
resolution rule should be in a tuple pairing the channel to which it applies and
the rule type. The first parameter identifies the type of resolution.

    resolve
        << resolution (reScale [ ( chY, reIndependent ) ])

values.name: resolve
values.comment:
Determine whether scales, axes or legends in composite views should share channel
encodings.

values.name: rgb
values.comment:
RGB color interpolation for continuous color scales using the given gamma
value (anchored at 1).

values.name: row
values.comment:
Encode a new facet to be arranged in rows. The first parameter is a list of
facet properties that define the faceting channel. See the
[Vega-Lite row documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/facet.html#row--column-encoding-channels)
values.type: List.List VegaLite.FacetChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: rowBy
values.comment:
Tthe mapping between a row and its field definitions in a set of faceted
small multiples.

values.name: rowFields
values.comment:
Create a list of fields to use in set of repeated small multiples arranged in
rows. The list of fields named here can be referenced in an encoding with
`pRepeat row`, `mRepeat row` etc.

values.name: rule
values.comment:
[Rule line](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/rule.html) connecting
two vertices.

values.name: sacoBandPaddingInner
values.comment: Default inner padding for x and y band-ordinal scales.

values.name: sacoBandPaddingOuter
values.comment: Default outer padding for x and y band-ordinal scales.

values.name: sacoBarBandPaddingInner
values.comment: Default inner padding for x and y band-ordinal scales of `bar` marks.

values.name: sacoBarBandPaddingOuter
values.comment: Default outer padding for x and y band-ordinal scales of `bar` marks.

values.name: sacoClamp
values.comment:
Whether or not by default values that exceed the data domain are clamped to
the min/max range value.

values.name: sacoMaxBandSize
values.comment:
Default maximum value for mapping quantitative fields to a bar's
size/bandSize.

values.name: sacoMaxFontSize
values.comment:
Default maximum value for mapping a quantitative field to a text
mark's size.

values.name: sacoMaxOpacity
values.comment:
Default maximum opacity (in the range [0, 1]) for mapping a field
to opacity.

values.name: sacoMaxSize
values.comment: Default maximum size for point-based scales.

values.name: sacoMaxStrokeWidth
values.comment: Default maximum stroke width for rule, line and trail marks.

values.name: sacoMinBandSize
values.comment: Default minimum value for mapping quantitative fields to a bar's size/bandSize.

values.name: sacoMinFontSize
values.comment: Default minimum value for mapping a quantitative field to a text mark's size.

values.name: sacoMinOpacity
values.comment: Default minimum opacity (0 to 1) for mapping a field to opacity.

values.name: sacoMinSize
values.comment: Default minimum size for point-based scales (when not forced to start at zero).

values.name: sacoMinStrokeWidth
values.comment: Default minimum stroke width for rule, line and trail marks.

values.name: sacoPointPadding
values.comment: Default padding for point-ordinal scales.

values.name: sacoRangeStep
values.comment: Default range step for band and point scales when the mark is not text.

values.name: sacoRectBandPaddingInner
values.comment: Default inner padding for x and y band-ordinal scales of `rect` marks.

values.name: sacoRectBandPaddingOuter
values.comment: Default outer padding for x and y band-ordinal scales of `rect` marks.

values.name: sacoRound
values.comment:
Whether or not numeric values are rounded to integers when scaling. Useful
for snapping to the pixel grid.

values.name: sacoTextXRangeStep
values.comment: Default range step for x band and point scales of text marks.

values.name: sacoUseUnaggregatedDomain
values.comment: Whether or not to use the source data range before aggregation.

values.name: sample
values.comment: Randomly sample rows from a data source up to a given maximum.

values.name: scBand
values.comment: A band scale.

values.name: scBase
values.comment: The base to use for log scaling.

values.name: scBinLinear
values.comment: A linear band scale.

values.name: scBinOrdinal
values.comment: An ordinal band scale.

values.name: scClamp
values.comment:
Whether or not values outside the data domain are clamped to the minimum or
maximum value.

values.name: scDomain
values.comment: Custom scaling domain.

values.name: scExponent
values.comment: The exponent to use for power scaling.

values.name: scInterpolate
values.comment: Interpolation method for scaling range values.

values.name: scLinear
values.comment: A linear scale.

values.name: scLog
values.comment:
A log scale. Defaults to log of base 10, but can be customised by setting
[scBase](#scBase) to some other value.

values.name: scNice
values.comment: 'Nice' minimum and maximum values in a scaling (e.g. multiples of 10).

values.name: scOrdinal
values.comment: An ordinal scale.

values.name: scPadding
values.comment: Padding in pixels to apply to a scaling.

values.name: scPaddingInner
values.comment: Inner padding to apply to a band scaling.

values.name: scPaddingOuter
values.comment: Outer padding to apply to a band scaling.

values.name: scPoint
values.comment: A point scale.

values.name: scPow
values.comment:
A power scale. The exponent to use for scaling is specified with
[scExponent](#scExponent).

values.name: scQuantile
values.comment: A quantile scale.

values.name: scQuantize
values.comment: A quantizing scale.

values.name: scRange
values.comment: Range of a scaling. The type of range depends on the encoding channel.

values.name: scRangeStep
values.comment:
Distance between the starts of adjacent bands in a band scaling. If
`Nothing` is provided the distance is determined automatically.

values.name: scReverse
values.comment: Reverse the order of a scaling.

values.name: scRound
values.comment: Whether or not numeric values in a scaling are rounded to integers.

values.name: scScheme
values.comment:
Color scheme used by a color scaling. The first parameter is the name of the
scheme (e.g. "viridis") and the second an optional specification of the number of
colors to use (list of one number), or the extent of the color range to use (list
of two numbers between 0 and 1).

values.name: scSequential
values.comment: A sequential scale.

values.name: scSqrt
values.comment: A square root scale.

values.name: scThreshold
values.comment: A threshold scale.

values.name: scTime
values.comment: A temporal scale.

values.name: scType
values.comment: Type of scaling to apply.

values.name: scUtc
values.comment: A UTC temporal scale.

values.name: scZero
values.comment: Whether or not a numeric scaling should be forced to include a zero value.

values.name: seBind
values.comment: Binding to some input elements as part of a named selection.

values.name: seBindScales
values.comment: Enable two-way binding between a selection and the scales used in the same view.

values.name: seEmpty
values.comment: Make a selection empty by default when nothing selected.

values.name: seEncodings
values.comment: Encoding channels that form a named selection.

values.name: seFields
values.comment: Field names for projecting a selection.

values.name: seGlobal
values.comment: One selection available across all subviews (default).

values.name: seIntersection
values.comment:
Each subview contains its own brush and marks are selected if they lie
within _all_ of these individual selections.

values.name: seInterval
values.comment:
Indicate a draggable bounding rectangle can be made for selecting all items
that intersect with it.

values.name: seMulti
values.comment: Indicate multiple interactive mark selections can be made (e.g. with shift-click).

values.name: seNearest
values.comment:
Whether or not a selection should capture nearest marks to a pointer
rather than an exact position match.

values.name: seOn
values.comment:
[Vega event stream](https://vega.github.io/vega/docs/event-streams)
that triggers a selection.

values.name: seResolve
values.comment:
Strategy that determines how selections data queries are resolved when applied
in a filter transform, conditional encoding rule, or scale domain.

values.name: seSelectionMark
values.comment: Appearance of an interval selection mark (dragged rectangle).

values.name: seSingle
values.comment: Indicate a single, mark at a time, interactive selection can be made.

values.name: seToggle
values.comment:
Predicate expression that determines a toggled selection. See the
[Vega-Lite toggle documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/toggle.html)

values.name: seTranslate
values.comment:
Translation selection transformation used for panning a view. See the
[Vega-Lite translate documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/translate.html)

values.name: seUnion
values.comment:
Each subview contains its own brush and marks are selected if they lie
within _any_ of these individual selections.

values.name: seZoom
values.comment:
Zooming selection transformation used for zooming a view. See the
[Vega-Lite zoom documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/zoom.html)

values.name: seconds
values.comment: Second of a minute time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: secondsMilliseconds
values.comment: Seconds and milliseconds time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: select
values.comment:
Create a single named selection that may be applied to a data query or transformation.
The first two parameters specify the name to be given to the selection for later
reference and the type of selection made. The third allows additional selection options to
be specified.
values.type: String.String -> VegaLite.Selection -> List.List VegaLite.SelectionProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: selected
values.comment:
Interactive selection that will be true or false as part of a logical composition.
e.g., to filter a dataset so that only items selected interactively and that have
a weight of more than 30:

    transform
        << filter (fCompose (and (selected "brush") (expr "datum.weight > 30")))

values.name: selection
values.comment:
Create a full selection specification from a list of selections.

    sel =
        selection
            << select "view" seInterval [ seBindScales ] []
            << select "myBrush" seInterval []
            << select "myPaintbrush" seMulti [ seOn "mouseover", seNearest True ]

values.name: selectionName
values.comment:
Name a selection that is used as part of a conditional encoding.

    color
        [ mSelectionCondition (selectionName "myBrush")
            [ mName "myField", mMType Nominal ]
            [ mStr "grey" ]
        ]

values.name: shape
values.comment: Encode a shape channel.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: siBottom
values.comment: Bottom side, used to specify an axis position.

values.name: siLeft
values.comment: Left side, used to specify an axis position.

values.name: siRight
values.comment: Right side, used to specify an axis position.

values.name: siTop
values.comment: Top side, used to specify an axis position.

values.name: size
values.comment: Encode a size channel with a list of mark channel properties.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: smFill
values.comment: Fill color of an interval selection mark (dragged rectangular area).

values.name: smFillOpacity
values.comment: Fill opacity of an interval selection mark in the range 0 to 1.

values.name: smStroke
values.comment: Stroke color of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeDash
values.comment: Stroke dash style of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeDashOffset
values.comment: Stroke dash offset of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeOpacity
values.comment: Stroke opacity of an interval selection mark in the range 0 to 1.

values.name: smStrokeWidth
values.comment: Stroke width of an interval selection mark.

values.name: soAscending
values.comment: Indicate sorting is to be applied from low to high.

values.name: soByField
values.comment:
Sort by the aggregated summary of a given field using a given aggregation
operation. e.g., sort the categorical data field `variety` by the mean age of
the data in each variety category:

    position Y
        [ pName "variety"
        , pMType Ordinal
        , pSort [ soByField "age" opMean, soDescending ]
        ]

values.name: soByRepeat
values.comment:
Sort by the aggregated summaries of the given fields (referenced by a repeat
iteration) using a given aggregation operation.

values.name: soCustom
values.comment: Custom sort order listing data values explicitly.

values.name: soDescending
values.comment: Indicate sorting is to be applied from high to low.

values.name: spacing
values.comment: Spacing between sub-views in a composition operator.

values.name: spacingRC
values.comment:
Similar to [spacing](#spacing) but with independent spacing for rows (first
parameter) and columns (second parameter).

values.name: specification
values.comment:
Define a specification object for use with faceted and repeated small multiples.

    spec = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ facet [ rowBy [ fName "Origin", fMType Nominal ] ]
        , specifcation spec
        ]

values.name: square
values.comment:
[Square mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/square.html) for symbolising
points.

values.name: stAscending
values.comment: Indicate that the given field should be sorted in ascending order.

values.name: stCenter
values.comment: Offset a stacked layout using a central stack baseline.

values.name: stDescending
values.comment: Indicate that the given field should be sorted in descending order.

values.name: stNone
values.comment: Do not stack marks (produces a layed plot).

values.name: stNormalize
values.comment:
Rescale a stacked layout to use a common height while preserving relative size
of stacked quantities.

values.name: stOffset
values.comment: Stack offset when applying a stack transformation.

values.name: stSort
values.comment: Ordering within a stack when applying a stack transformation.

values.name: stZero
values.comment: Offset a stacked layout using a baseline at the foot of a stack.

values.name: stack
values.comment:
Apply a stack transform for positioning multiple values. This is an alternative
to specifying stacking directly when encoding position. First parameter is the field
to be stacked; the second the fields to group by; the third and fourth are the names
to give the output field names; the fifth lists the optional offset and sort properties.
values.type: String.String -> List.List String.String -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.StackProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: stereographic
values.comment: A stereographic map projection.

values.name: str
values.comment: A string data value.

values.name: stroke
values.comment:
Encode a stroke channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by `color` but
only affects the exterior boundary of marks.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strokeOpacity
values.comment:
Encode a stroke opacity channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by
`opacity` but only affects the exterior boundary of marks. If both `opacity` and
`strokeOpacity` are specified, `strokeOpacity` takes precedence for stroke encoding.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strokeWidth
values.comment: Encode a stroke width channel.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strs
values.comment: A list of string data values.

values.name: symCircle
values.comment: Specify a circular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symCross
values.comment: Specify a cross symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symDiamond
values.comment: Specify a diamond symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symPath
values.comment:
A custom symbol shape as an
[SVG path description](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Tutorial/Paths).

values.name: symSquare
values.comment: Specify a square symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symTriangleDown
values.comment: Specify a downward triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symTriangleUp
values.comment: Specify an upward triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: tAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
text channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: tBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tBinned
values.comment: Indicate that data encoded with a text channel are already binned.

values.name: tDataCondition
values.comment:
Make a text channel conditional on one or more predicate expressions. The first
parameter is a list of tuples each pairing an expression to evaluate with the encoding
if that expression is true. The second is the encoding if none of the expressions
are evaluated as true.
values.type: List.List ( VegaLite.BooleanOp, List.List VegaLite.TextChannel ) -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> VegaLite.TextChannel

values.name: tFormat
values.comment:
[Formatting pattern](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/format.html)
for a field when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tMType
values.comment: Level of measurement when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tName
values.comment: Name of the field used for encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tRepeat
values.comment:
Reference in a text channel to a field name generated by `repeat`. The
parameter identifies whether reference is being made to fields that are to be
laid out in columns or in rows.

values.name: tSelectionCondition
values.comment:
Make a text channel conditional on interactive selection. The first parameter
is a selection condition to evaluate; the second the encoding to apply if that
selection is true; the third parameter is the encoding if the selection is false.
values.type: VegaLite.BooleanOp -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> VegaLite.TextChannel

values.name: tTimeUnit
values.comment: Time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tTitle
values.comment: Title of a field when encoding with a text or tooltip channel.

values.name: text
values.comment: Encode a text channel.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: textMark
values.comment:
[Text mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/text.html) to be
displayed at some point location.

values.name: tick
values.comment:
Short line ([tick](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/tick.html))
mark for symbolising point locations.

values.name: ticoAnchor
values.comment: Default anchor position when placing titles.

values.name: ticoAngle
values.comment: Default angle when orientating titles.

values.name: ticoBaseline
values.comment: Default vertical alignment when placing titles.

values.name: ticoColor
values.comment: Default color when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFont
values.comment: Default font when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFontSize
values.comment: Default font size when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFontWeight
values.comment: Default font weight when showing titles.

values.name: ticoLimit
values.comment: Default maximum length in pixel units when showing titles.

values.name: ticoOffset
values.comment: Default offset in pixel units of titles relative to the chart body.

values.name: ticoOrient
values.comment: Default placement of titles relative to the chart body.

values.name: timeUnitAs
values.comment:
Create a new data field based on the given temporal binning. Unlike the
direct encoding binning, this transformation is named and so can be referred
to in multiple encodings. The first parameter is the width of each temporal bin,
the second is the field to bin and the third is name to give the newly binned
field.
values.type: VegaLite.TimeUnit -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: title
values.comment: Title to be displayed in the visualization.

values.name: toVegaLite
values.comment:
Convert a list of Vega-Lite specifications into a single JSON object that may be
passed to Vega-Lite for graphics generation. Commonly these will include at least
data, mark and encoding specifications.

While simple functions like `bar` may be provided directly, it is usually clearer
to label more complex ones such as encodings as separate expressions.

Specifications can be built up by chaining functions such as `dataColumn` or
`position`. Functional composition using the `<<` operator allows this to be done
compactly.

    let
        data =
            dataFromColumns []
                << dataColumn "a" (strs [ "C", "C", "D", "E" ])
                << dataColumn "b" (nums [ 2, 7, 1, 2 ])

        enc =
            encoding
                << position X [ pName "a", pMType Nominal ]
                << position Y [ pName "b", pMType Quantitative, pAggregate opMean ]
    in
    toVegaLite [ data [], bar [], enc [] ]

values.name: tooltip
values.comment:
Encode a tooltip channel. To encode multiple tooltip values with a mark, use
[tooltips](#tooltips).
values.type: List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: tooltips
values.comment:
Encode a tooltip channel with multiple tooltips. The first parameter is a
list of the multiple tooltips, each of which is a list of text channel properties
that define the channel.
values.type: List.List (List.List VegaLite.TextChannel) -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: topojsonFeature
values.comment: A topoJSON feature format containing an object with the given name.

values.name: topojsonMesh
values.comment:
A topoJSON mesh format containing an object with the given name. Unlike
`topojsonFeature`, the corresponding geo data are returned as a single unified mesh,
not as individual GeoJSON features.

values.name: trail
values.comment:
[Trail mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/trail.html) (line
with variable width along its length).

values.name: transform
values.comment:
Create a single transform from a list of transformation specifications. The
order of transformations can be important, e.g. labels created with [calculateAs](#calculateAs),
[timeUnitAs](#timeUnitAs) and [binAs](#binAs) that are used in other transformations.
Using the functional composition pipeline idiom (as example below) allows you to
provide the transformations in the order intended in a clear manner.

    trans =
        transform
            << filter (fiExpr "datum.year == 2010")
            << calculateAs "datum.sex == 2 ? 'Female' : 'Male'" "gender"

values.name: transverseMercator
values.comment: A transverse Mercator map projection.

values.name: true
values.comment:
A true value used for functions that can accept a Boolean literal or a reference
to something that generates a Boolean value. Convenience function equivalent to `boo True`

values.name: tsv
values.comment:
TSV data file format (only necessary if the file extension does not indicate the
type).

values.name: ttData
values.comment: Indicate tooltips are generated by data.

values.name: ttEncoding
values.comment: Indicate tooltips are generated by encoding (default).

values.name: utc
values.comment:
UTC version of a given a time (coordinated universal time, independent of local
time zones or daylight saving). To encode a time as UTC (coordinated universal time,
independent of local time zones or daylight saving), just use this function to convert
another `TimeUnit` generating function. For example,

    encoding
        << position X [ pName "date", pMType Temporal, pTimeUnit (utc yearMonthDateHours) ]

values.name: vConcat
values.comment: Specifications to be juxtaposed vertically in a visualization.

values.name: vaBottom
values.comment: Bottom vertical text alignment.

values.name: vaMiddle
values.comment: Middle vertical text alignment.

values.name: vaTop
values.comment: Top vertical text alignment.

values.name: vicoClip
values.comment: Whether or not by default single views should be clipped.

values.name: vicoFill
values.comment: Default fill color for single views.

values.name: vicoFillOpacity
values.comment: Default fill opacity for single views.

values.name: vicoHeight
values.comment: Default height of single views (e.g. each view in a trellis plot).

values.name: vicoStroke
values.comment:
Default stroke color for single views. If `Nothing` is provided,
no strokes are drawn around the view.

values.name: vicoStrokeDash
values.comment: Default stroke dash style for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeDashOffset
values.comment: Default stroke dash offset for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeOpacity
values.comment: Default stroke opacity for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeWidth
values.comment: Default stroke width of single views.

values.name: vicoWidth
values.comment: Default width of single views (e.g. each view in a trellis plot).

values.name: wiAggregateOp
values.comment: An aggregrate operation to be used in a window transformation.

values.name: wiAscending
values.comment:
Indicate that the given field should be sorted in ascending order when performing
a window transform.

values.name: wiDescending
values.comment:
Indicate that the given field should be sorted in descending order when performing
a window transform.

values.name: wiField
values.comment:
Field for which to compute a window operation. Not needed for
operations that do not apply to fields such as `opCount`, `woRank` and `woDenseRank`.

values.name: wiFrame
values.comment:
Moving window for use by a window transform. The two parameters
should either be `Just` a number indicating the offset from the current data object,
or `Nothing` to indicate unbounded rows preceding or following the current data object.

values.name: wiGroupBy
values.comment:
Fields for partitioning data objects in a window transform into separate windows.
If unspecified, all points will be in a single group.

values.name: wiIgnorePeers
values.comment:
Whether or not the sliding window frame in a window transform should ignore
peer values (those considered identical by the sort criteria).

values.name: wiOp
values.comment: Window-specific operation to be used in a window transformation.

values.name: wiParam
values.comment:
Numeric parameter for window-only operations that can be parameterised
(`woPercentile`, `woLag`, `woLead` and `woNthValue`).

values.name: wiSort
values.comment: Comparator for sorting data objects within a window transform.

values.name: width
values.comment:
Override the default width of the visualization. If not specified the width
will be calculated based on the content of the visualization.

values.name: window
values.comment:
Window transform for performing calculations over sorted groups of
data objects such as ranking, lead/lag analysis, running sums and averages.

The first parameter is a list of tuples each comprising a window transform field
definition and an output name. The second is the window transform definition.

       trans =
           transform
               << window [ ( [ wiAggregateOp opSum, wiField "Time" ], "TotalTime" ) ]
                   [ wiFrame Nothing Nothing ]
values.type: List.List ( List.List VegaLite.Window, String.String ) -> List.List VegaLite.WindowProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: woCumeDist
values.comment: Cumulative distribution function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woDenseRank
values.comment: Dense rank function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woFirstValue
values.comment: First value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLag
values.comment: Value preceding the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLastValue
values.comment: Last value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLead
values.comment: Value following the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woNthValue
values.comment: Nth value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woPercentRank
values.comment: Percentile of values in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woPercentile
values.comment: Value preceding the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woRank
values.comment: Rank function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woRowNumber
values.comment: Assign consecutive row number to values in a data object to be applied in a window transform.
